The World Health Organization: WHO) has stated that there is no evidence to support the claim that consuming garlic can treat or cure the new coronavirus.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) also confirm that there are no recommended vaccines or antiviral treatments for the new coronavirus.
A systematic review cited by the Nationa: NCCIH) found insufficient evidence to suggest that garlic can prevent or treat the common cold, let alone the new coronavirus.
While garlic may have some antimicrobial: it is generally safe to consume in the amount usually found in food, according to the NCCIH. However, this does not mean it can effectively treat or cure the virus.
